question: I have a male friend who is over 50 y.o.with AODM for over 10 years on oral hypoglycemics and a med. for hyperlipidemia,ASA, has diabetic neuropathy and takes Lyrica, has BPH. No hypertension. Last UA revealed 1+ protein as did the previous. Has one kidney,(other removed due to congenital atrophy). He has asked his PCP but was told he does not need to be on antihypertensive medication.Is it not protocol with diabetics, even without HTN, that they are placed on a beta blocker to protect their kidneys?
title: diabetes and protocol treatment
